definition: the war of 1904-1905 between Russia and Japan
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
Russia/Russian/abbr. for 俄羅斯|俄罗斯[E2 luo2 si1]/Taiwan pr. [E4]
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: After the Russo-Japanese War, Japan's occupation of southern Sakhalin in Russia.
sentences.chinese: 日俄战争后，日本占领俄国库页岛南部。

sentences.english: The Russo-Japanese war of 1904-1905 was a military disaster for Russia.
sentences.chinese: 1905年的日俄战争令俄国遭到重创。

sentences.english: At the same time, Japan speeded up sending troops to Northeast China, then the Russo-Japanese War began.
sentences.chinese: 同时，日本加快向中国东北调动部队，日俄战争爆发。

sentences.english: In 1906 he again went to Japan after the Russo-Japanese War in exactly.
sentences.chinese: 1906年他再次东渡日本，恰在日俄战争后。

definition: Tsarist Russia/abbr. for 沙皇俄國|沙皇俄国[Sha1 huang2 E2 guo2]
Pacific War between Japan and the US, 1941-1945
the Mukden or Manchurian Railway Incident of 18th September 1931 used by the Japanese as a pretext to annex Manchuria/also known as Liutiaogou incident 柳條溝事變|柳条沟事变
Japanese Kwantung army (or Kantō army), notorious for numerous atrocities in China during WWII

definition: Sino-French War (1883-1885) (concerning French seizure of Vietnam)
